item.title: Nearly 1 In 5 Hospice Patients Discharged While Still Alive
item.description:
August 11, 2017 - The hospices who discharge the most patients before their death also make the most money, a recent study shows.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/11/542607941/nearly-1-in-5-hospice-patients-discharged-while-still-alive
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 11, 2017 - The hospices who discharge the most patients before their death also make the most money, a recent study shows. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/11/542607941/nearly-1-in-5-hospice-patients-discharged-while-still-alive

item.title: 2016 Hit Records For Global Temperature And Climate Extremes
item.description: August 10, 2017 - An annual report, comprising data from scientists across the globe, shows it was the warmest on records that date back 137 years. It also saw the highest sea levels and lowest polar sea ice.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - An annual report, comprising data from scientists across the globe, shows it was the warmest on records that date back 137 years. It also saw the highest sea levels and lowest polar sea ice. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/10/542720189/2016-hit-records-for-global-temperature-and-climate-extremes

item.title: People Back Editing Genes To Treat Disease, But Are Wary Of Inheritable Changes
item.description: August 10, 2017 - Scientists are getting closer to being able to alter people's genes permanently. A survey found that people are more cautious about changes that could be passed on to future generations.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - Scientists are getting closer to being able to alter people's genes permanently. A survey found that people are more cautious about changes that could be passed on to future generations. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/10/542659066/people-back-editing-genes-to-treat-disease-but-are-wary-of-inheritable-changes

item.title: Environmental Penalties Down Under President Trump
item.description:
August 10, 2017 - A new report shows the EPA has collected 60 percent less in civil penalties from polluters compared with recent administrations.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/08/10/542603483/environmental-penalties-are-down-under-president-trump
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - A new report shows the EPA has collected 60 percent less in civil penalties from polluters compared with recent administrations. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/10/542603483/environmental-penalties-are-down-under-president-trump

item.title: Widowed Early, A Cancer Doctor Writes About The Harm Of Medical Debt
item.description: August 10, 2017 - A decade after the death of her husband, Fumiko Chino is studying the strain that uncovered medical costs put on cancer patients, even those who have insurance.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - A decade after the death of her husband, Fumiko Chino is studying the strain that uncovered medical costs put on cancer patients, even those who have insurance. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/10/542589232/widowed-early-a-cancer-doctor-writes-about-the-harm-of-medical-debt

item.title: As Eclipse Madness Sweeps U.S., A Stonehenge Made Of Cars Prepares
item.description: August 10, 2017 - Carhenge in Alliance, Neb., will be prime viewing for this month's total solar eclipse. The town is preparing for thousands of visitors.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 10, 2017 - Carhenge in Alliance, Neb., will be prime viewing for this month's total solar eclipse. The town is preparing for thousands of visitors. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/10/541583064/as-eclipse-madness-sweeps-u-s-a-stonehenge-made-of-cars-prepares

item.title: Hurricane Franklin, First Of Atlantic Season, Barrels Toward Mexico's Coast
item.description: August 9, 2017 - The storm is expected to make landfall north of Veracruz, where it could dump as much as 15 inches of rain, causing "life-threatening flash floods and mudslides."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - The storm is expected to make landfall north of Veracruz, where it could dump as much as 15 inches of rain, causing "life-threatening flash floods and mudslides." http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/09/542510195/hurricane-franklin-first-of-atlantic-season-barrels-toward-mexicos-coast

item.title: 47 Hospitals Slashed Their Use Of 2 Key Heart Drugs After Huge Price Hikes
item.description: August 9, 2017 - These two older drugs, nitroprusside and isoproterenol, are frequently used in emergency and intensive care situations and have no direct alternatives, say cardiologists.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - These two older drugs, nitroprusside and isoproterenol, are frequently used in emergency and intensive care situations and have no direct alternatives, say cardiologists. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/08/09/542485307/47-hospitals-slashed-their-use-of-two-key-heart-drugs-after-huge-price-hikes

item.title: Belgian And Dutch Officials Point Fingers Amid Egg Contamination Scare
item.description: August 9, 2017 - Millions of eggs have been recalled in European countries afraid they've been contaminated with insecticide. Who is to blame, though? That question is now a matter of international discord.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - Millions of eggs have been recalled in European countries afraid they've been contaminated with insecticide. Who is to blame, though? That question is now a matter of international discord. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/09/542470613/belgian-and-dutch-officials-point-fingers-amid-egg-contamination-scare

item.title: Some Tuna Can Carry Up To 36 Times The Toxic Chemicals Of Others. Here's Why
item.description: August 9, 2017 - When it comes to pollutant levels, researchers now say where your tuna was caught can make a huge difference. But tracking your yellowfin to the spot it was caught may be tricky.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - When it comes to pollutant levels, researchers now say where your tuna was caught can make a huge difference. But tracking your yellowfin to the spot it was caught may be tricky. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/08/09/542488351/some-tuna-can-carry-up-36-times-the-toxins-of-others-heres-why

item.title: Trump Claims To Have Modernized The U.S. Nuclear Arsenal
item.description: August 9, 2017 - On Wednesday, President Trump tweeted that he modernized the U.S. nuclear arsenal as his first act in office. But others question that claim. NPR takes a closer look at America's nuclear capabilities.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - On Wednesday, President Trump tweeted that he modernized the U.S. nuclear arsenal as his first act in office. But others question that claim. NPR takes a closer look at America's nuclear capabilities. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/09/542468244/trump-claims-to-have-modernized-the-u-s-nuclear-arsenal

item.title: Ahead Of Solar Eclipse, Small Town Prepares For Light Among The Darkness
item.description: August 9, 2017 - When the total solar eclipse crosses North America next month, one city will be dark for the longest time. Hopkinsville, Ky., is a small town making big preparations for the big event.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - When the total solar eclipse crosses North America next month, one city will be dark for the longest time. Hopkinsville, Ky., is a small town making big preparations for the big event. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/09/542468196/ahead-of-solar-eclipse-small-town-prepares-for-light-among-the-darkness

item.title: Perseid Meteor Shower Falls Victim To Fake News. Sad!
item.description: August 9, 2017 - It seems nothing is safe from fake news this year, not even the annual astronomical event. This year's Perseid show will be at its peak Saturday night into Sunday.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - It seems nothing is safe from fake news this year, not even the annual astronomical event. This year's Perseid show will be at its peak Saturday night into Sunday. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/09/542455857/perseid-meteor-shower-falls-victim-to-fake-news-sad

item.title: This Could Be The Biggest Dinosaur Ever Found â€” And It's Finally Got A Name
item.description: August 9, 2017 - After years of study, scientists have given a name to the prehistoric colossus: Patagotitan mayorum. And in a paper published Wednesday, researchers offered the world a closer glimpse.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - After years of study, scientists have given a name to the prehistoric colossus: Patagotitan mayorum. And in a paper published Wednesday, researchers offered the world a closer glimpse. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/08/09/542396807/this-could-be-the-biggest-dinosaur-ever-found-and-its-finally-got-a-name

item.title: Earliest-Known Winged Mammal Relatives Discovered In China
item.description: August 9, 2017 - These 160-million-year-old fossils are the oldest known examples of mammal relatives with the ability to glide. They're from an extinct lineage with no relationship to modern gliders.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 9, 2017 - These 160-million-year-old fossils are the oldest known examples of mammal relatives with the ability to glide. They're from an extinct lineage with no relationship to modern gliders. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/09/542078677/earliest-known-winged-mammal-relatives-discovered-in-china
